intro: Sonchus australis, commonly known as the Australian sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lobed leaves that are hairy and often covered in fine white hairs. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sonchus australis is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
